## Business

The Issuer is a holding and finance company and does not conduct any business operations of its
own. The main assets of the Issuer are 500,000,000 common shares in Schaeffler AG (representing
100% of the voting shares, 75.1% of the total share capital of Schaeffler AG), 71,990,458 common
shares in Continental AG (representing 36.0% of the total share capital of Continental AG) and
15,984,093 common shares in Vitesco AG (representing 39.9% of the total share capital of Vitesco
AG). The operating business described throughout this Offering Memorandum is that of the
Schaeffler Group.

### The Issuer

The Issuer is a holding and finance company underpinned by three main assets: a 75.1% stake
(representing 100% of the voting rights) in Schaeffler AG, a 36.0% stake in Continental AG and, since
its spin-off from Continental AG in September 2021, a stake in Vitesco AG that the Issuer increased to
39.9% in 2022. Schaeffler AG, Continental AG, and Vitesco AG are global manufacturing companies
headquartered in Germany and listed on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange. As of March 16, 2023,
Schaeffler AG had a market capitalization (including voting and non-voting shares) of €4,417 million
(based on the volume weighted average price per non-voting share of Schaeffler AG quoted on the
Frankfurt Stock Exchange during the last 60 trading days), Continental AG had a market capitalization
of €13,487 million (based on the volume weighted average price per share of Continental AG quoted
on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange during the last 60 trading days) and Vitesco AG had a market
capitalization of €2,517 million (based on the volume weighted average price per share of Vitesco AG
quoted on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange during the last 60 trading days). We believe that the Issuer’s
“three pillar” model represents strategic value, benefiting from exposure to its three complementary
underlying assets and from the Schaeffler Family’s history of value creation.

### Schaeffler Group Overview

We develop and manufacture high-precision components, systems and services for powertrains and
chassis, as well as rolling and plain bearing solutions for various industry applications. This includes
innovative and sustainable technologies for hybrid, electric and combustion-engine powered
vehicles. Our offering comprises solutions for automated and autonomous driving, components and
systems for rotary and linear motion, as well as services, maintenance products and monitoring
systems for a wide range of industrial applications. Our portfolio also includes OEM-quality repair
solutions and associated supporting services for the global automotive aftermarket.

We are one of the largest family-controlled technology companies in the world, with approximately
82,800 employees and a network of production and manufacturing locations, R&D facilities and
distribution companies in approximately 200 locations in over 50 countries (as of December 31,
2022). Our 76 plants form the foundation of our operations.

In 2022, we had consolidated revenues of €15.8 billion and Adjusted EBITDA of €2.0 billion in 2022.
For an explanation of the components of Adjusted EBITDA and a reconciliation of net income to
Adjusted EBITDA, see “Summary Financial Information—Summary Financial Information of Schaeffler
_AG (IFRS)—Other Financial and Operating Data.” We have a large and growing presence in a number_
of growth markets, such as China and the rest of Asia. We believe that we benefit from our advanced
technology platform, high product quality, long-standing and diversified customer relationships,
broad distribution channels, global production footprint and extensive product, systems solutions
and service offering.

We operate through three divisions: Automotive Technologies, Automotive Aftermarket and
Industrial.


-----

- **_Automotive Technologies Division: Our Automotive Technologies Division partners with the_**
global automotive industry in developing and manufacturing components and system solutions
for electric and hybrid powertrains and fuel cell powertrains, as well as for internal combustion
engines and chassis systems. The Division also offers a wide range of rolling bearings that is
largely powertrain-agnostic. Our Automotive Technologies Division accounted for 60.1% of our
consolidated revenue and 27.9% of our Adjusted EBIT in 2022. We supply approximately
17,000 products to all major automotive OEMs as well as approximately 1,100 automotive
suppliers globally through our Automotive Technologies Division. As a partner of the
automotive sector, we are at the forefront of developing and manufacturing a broad range of
automotive applications. Our operating excellence relates to components and system solutions
for vehicles with powertrains based on the internal combustion engine, as well as for hybrid
and electric vehicles. Our main products include electric drives, clutch systems, transmission
components, torsion dampers, valve train systems and camshaft phasing units and electric
drives. Our precision products are key to helping make engines more fuel-efficient and
compliant with increasingly strict emission requirements. At the same time, they also increase
driving comfort and vehicle dynamics and extend maintenance intervals and service life. As an
advanced global automotive supplier, we offer extensive technical expertise for the entire
powertrain.

- **_Automotive Aftermarket Division: Our Automotive Aftermarket Division complements the_**
Automotive Technologies Division with an extensive aftermarket offering. It accounted for
12.9% of our consolidated revenue and 24.4% of our Adjusted EBIT in 2022. Our Automotive
Aftermarket Division provides an extensive aftermarket offering, which includes the
distribution of spare parts and services to approximately 2,100 customers globally. Customers
mainly include almost all major international and national trading companies. In addition to
the traditional component business consisting of replacement parts, our Automotive
Aftermarket Division develops and distributes repair sets and custom assembled kits for
passenger cars, light and heavy duty commercial vehicles and tractors, to help make vehicle
repairs simple, efficient and professional. The Automotive Aftermarket Division uses two
primary distribution channels to sell its products and services to customers, the original
equipment service (“OES”), which supplies original spare parts to automobile OEMs for their
branded repair shops, and the open (independent) spare parts market or independent
aftermarket (“IAM”), which supplies components and repair solutions and services to a global
network of independent parts distributors, which supply workshops that are not affiliated with
any particular automobile OEM. A considerable portion of IAM’s sales market comprises of
distributors organized in trade cooperatives. The Automotive Aftermarket Division is largely
supplied from the Automotive Technologies Division’s production and manufacturing
locations.

- **_Industrial Division: The Industrial Division develops and manufactures components and_**
systems for rotary and linear movements as well as services such as maintenance products and
monitoring systems. It accounted for 27.0% of our consolidated revenue and 47.7% of our
Adjusted EBIT in 2022. We supply approximately 59,200 products to customers in a variety of
different industrial sectors which we group into eight sector clusters within four market
clusters: renewables (wind), transportation and mobility (aerospace, rail, offroad and twowheelers), machinery and materials (raw materials and power transmission) and industrial
automation (industrial automation). The Industrial Division is also developing new products
and solutions for the hydrogen economy. The product portfolio of the Industrial Division
includes a wide range of rolling and plain bearings, linear and direct drive technologies as well
as services such as maintenance products and monitoring systems. The market focus is
increasingly on smart products and connected components that increase machine and plant
efficiency. We believe that customers require intelligent solutions and optimized lifecycle


-----

costs, which opens up new growth areas for the Industrial Division. Our strategic business field
“Lifetime Solutions”, is aimed at developing these areas, which we consider to be significant
growth opportunities for our business. Lifetime Solutions combines the entire industry-specific
business with mechatronic systems and digital services as well as the required related
components. We complement our business with an extensive aftermarket offering, which
includes the distribution of spare parts and services to customers worldwide.

We have a strong global presence. Our business activities are divided into four regions: Europe
(Germany, Western Europe, Middle East & Africa, Central & Eastern Europe), the Americas (the U.S.
& Canada, South America, Mexico), Greater China (including Mainland China, also Taiwan, Hong Kong
and Macao) and Asia/Pacific (South Korea, Japan, Southeast Asia and India). In addition to the
traditional core markets in Europe (41.5% of our consolidated revenue in 2022) and the Americas
(22.3% of our consolidated revenue in 2022), our business in the Greater China and Asia/Pacific
regions, which accounted for 22.8% and 13.4%, respectively, of our consolidated revenue in 2022,
has contributed significantly to our overall growth in recent years. In particular, despite the
significant decline in 2020 revenue resulting from the COVID-19 pandemic, revenues in the Greater
China Region increased by 6.8% in 2020. Following our integrated “as regional as possible” approach,
we have built a global manufacturing footprint with each of our plants having a strong regional
foothold. As of December 31, 2022, we operated 44 plants in Europe, 13 in the Americas, ten in
Greater China and nine in Asia/Pacific. Nearly all of our plants are certified under globally recognized
quality norms, standards, and regulations. In addition, as part of the Ewellix Acquisition in January
2023, we acquired six additional manufacturing and customization sites in Europe, the U.S. and Asia
(please note that the Ewellix Group sites are not consolidated with the Schaeffler Group plants for
purposes of the discussions of the latter in this Offering Memorandum).

### Competitive Strengths 

We believe that the following competitive strengths have been the primary drivers of our success in
the past and will continue to set us apart from our competitors in the future:

**_German Precision Engineering and Manufacturing Company with Strong Global Positions across_**
**_Portfolio Based on Quality and Technology_**

We have a long tradition of precision engineering and manufacturing expertise, particularly in the
area of high-precision mechanical components and systems. This expertise has enabled us to gain
leading positions across our core customer sectors: two-wheelers, passenger cars & light commercial
vehicles, truck & bus, offroad, rail, aerospace, raw materials, industrial automation, power
transmission, and wind. Based on our research, we believe we are among the leading companies in
the engine, transmission, chassis systems and E-mobility sectors, and in particular in engine valve
train components, dual mass flywheels, ball screw drives for electrical power steering and electric
drive solutions. Being a partner to manufacturers of passenger cars and commercial vehicles, the
Automotive Technologies Division is actively involved in shaping technological change in the industry
via its R&D activities and expects that in 2035, approximately 60% of all passenger cars and light
commercial vehicles will have all-electric drive systems and approximately 30% will have a hybrid
powertrain (a combination of an electric motor and an internal combustion unit), and also by 2035,
approximately 10% of passengers cars and light commercial vehicles manufactured will be driven in a
highly automated manner and approximately 15% in a partly automated manner. The R&D activities
of the Automotive Technologies Division are aimed at developing and expanding its expertise with
respect to mechatronic applications and systems for efficient, low-emission, and electrified
powertrains, as well as autonomous driving and strengthening the profitability and efficiency of its
extensive existing expertise in the field of mechatronics and mechanical systems. We believe our
Automotive Aftermarket Division is very well positioned within the market, particularly in the Europe
and Americas regions, offering all-in-one solutions with components in original equipment quality for


-----

a safe and proper vehicle repair. In our Industrial Division, high-quality components and an
understanding of how they interact within a system are fundamental to success in the systems
business and our “Lifetime Solutions” products offer comprehensive services in the age of
digitalization. For that reason, the Division is strengthening its existing extensive expertise in the
fields of mechatronics and mechanical systems and is also enhancing it with respect to mechatronic
systems and digitalization solutions. We support OEMs throughout their full product lifecycle, from
taking part in the early stages of product development to providing critical engineering application
know-how, and are therefore regarded as a key partner.

Quality and reliability are the key attributes of our products and services, as many of our products
are mission-critical to the performance, durability and safety of the equipment in which they are
installed. As our products are critical to the overall performance, safety and durability of the endproduct and generally represent only a small percentage of the overall costs of the end-product, the
primary criteria for purchasing decisions by our customers are quality and technological excellence
rather than price alone. Providing superior product quality to our customers is therefore key to our
business model and paramount to our success. A holistic quality management system in all of our
locations, including all manufacturing plants worldwide, has been designed to ensure compliance
with our high quality standards, which are monitored by means of regular internal audits. With
various quality assurance programs, and our comprehensive quality culture, as well as testing and
simulation processes, mostly developed in-house, we emphasize our goal of achieving zero-defect
quality for the entire supply chain worldwide, and we believe that we achieve failure rates that are
significantly lower than the industry average.

Our commitment to the highest industry quality standards and technological prowess are underlined
by the numerous awards and certifications our products and services have received, including
multiple awards from major automobile OEMs such as Volkswagen, Volvo, Ford, Nissan, Toyota and
General Motors and over 50 quality awards since 2020. In 2022, we received the Red Dot Best of the
Best Award in the category “Design Concept,” the Magna Supplier Award, we were a finalist for the
European Association of Automotive Supplier’s (CLEPA) Innovation Award in the category “Clean and
Sustainable Mobility” and were nominated for the 2022 German Innovation Award. In 2021, we
received Red Dot Design Awards in the two categories “Smart Product” and “Industrial Design,” a
Railsponsible Supplier Award in the category “Climate Change and Circular Economy,” the
Automotive News PACE E-Mobility award and its Innovation Partnership award, a Best Practice
Award from Rolls-Royce, the Golden Steering Wheel Award from the car magazine “AUTO BILD”
together with our collaboration partner Ford Motor Co. and the “Smart Technology Innovation of the
Year” award at the 2021 ASEAN Wind Future Awards.

**_Well Positioned for Structural Change in our Key Markets Based on our Strong Technology_**
**_Competence and Investments in Innovation_**

We consider our technology competence and our strong system integration capabilities to be among
our key competitive advantages. Our product innovations have formed the backbone of our success
for many decades, and we continuously invest in our products, services and processes to protect our
market positions. Our worldwide R&D capabilities include approximately 7,400 R&D staff at 20 R&D
centers and additional R&D locations in a total of 25 countries that are developing new products,
customer product applications, technologies, processes and methods for market-driven solutions. On
average over 2020, 2021 and 2022, we spent 5% of our consolidated revenue on R&D to continuously
improve our products and to position us at the forefront of our industry in terms of innovation and
quality of design. Our strong innovative ability is illustrated by the number of our patent applications
in recent years. With 1,266 patent registrations in 2022, we ranked fourth among Germany’s most
innovative companies according to the German Patent and Trademark Office (Deutsches Patent- und
_Markenamt, DPMA). In total, as of December 31, 2022, we held approximately 22,900 patents and_
patent applications.


-----

We believe that our focus on innovation, quality, system understanding, and high-precision
manufacturing positions us well to address the key trends that we expect to influence our business in
the future: sustainability & climate change, new mobility & powertrain electrification, autonomous
production, the data economy and digitalization and demographic change. In particular, European
legislation limiting CO2 emissions cause OEMs to focus on the optimization of efficiency, friction
reduction and valve train variability for conventional powertrains.

In the automotive sector, systems for electric axels and hybrid drive systems, autonomous driving,
connectivity and new mobility solutions as well as efficient internal combustion engines, automated
transmissions, are expected to be the main drivers of future growth. In 2022, we inaugurated our
new center of competence in software and electronics development in Pune, India and we began the
expansion of our E-mobility development and manufacturing campus in Buehl, Germany, to add a
new center of excellence for E-mobility. In 2021, we opened our new E-mobility plant in
Szombathely, Hungary. The plant is our first production plant worldwide dedicated to E-mobility and
it is a center for excellence for components and systems for electrified powertrains. Our Chassis
System BD also entered into a partnership with Mobileye B.V., a subsidiary of the Intel Group, which
will enable us to offer an autonomous, flexible, and adaptable vehicle platform based on Mobileye’s
technology.

In the industrial sectors, we believe that in particular the increasing demand in wind and other
renewable forms of energy as well as in the power transmission and industrial automation customer
segments, will drive future growth. In the course of 2021, we introduced our comprehensive and
automated condition monitoring solution “OPTIME,” which makes condition monitoring efficient,
easy to use and cost-effective across all indirectly process-critical assets for entire machine and
equipment parks. Since its introduction, OPTIME has been implemented in more than 170 customer
plants and 37 of our own plants. See “Industry—Industrial—Historical and Forecast Market
_Development” and “—Our Divisions—Industrial Division—Strategic Business Areas” and “Industry—_
_Industrial—Historical and Forecast Development.”_

We believe that in many of these areas we are a frontrunner, and we have recently made selective
acquisitions and entered into joint ventures to further strengthen our production and product
spectrum and to expand our technological expertise. For example, in 2021, we expanded the services
offering of our Industrial Division when we acquired Bega, a manufacturer of special tools for
mounting and dismounting roller bearings. In 2022, we acquired Schaeffler Ultra Precision Drives
GmbH, formerly Melior Motion GmbH (“Schaeffler Ultra Precision Drives”) and a manufacturer of
innovative precision gearboxes for industrial robots, we acquired the remaining interest in Schaeffler
ByWire, which develops and sells the steer-by-wire steering technology “Space Drive,” a key
technology for autonomous driving. We also entered into our joint venture Innoplate, with Symbio
SAS, itself a joint venture of Faurecia and Michelin hydrogen company, to produce fuel cell bipolar
plates, a strategic fuel cell component, for global mobility and energy solutions. In addition, we
acquired CERASPIN, a manufacturer of high-quality ceramic components for roller bearings used in a
wide range of strategic growth areas, including wind energy, rail, aerospace, medical equipment,
electrical engineering and the semiconductor industry. In January 2023, we acquired the Ewellix
Group, a manufacturer of innovative linear motion and actuation solutions used in assembly
automation, medical applications and mobile machinery.

Consistently increasing technological requirements lead to growing demand for our technologicallyadvanced products, as they are more and more integrated into the respective end-applications. This
has enabled us, in many cases, to increase the percentage of the value of our end customer’s product
that is composed of products we supply. Globally, we have been able to increase our content per
vehicle (i.e., the Schaeffler Group’s annual automotive revenues, excluding aftermarket revenues,
truck revenues and other revenues (e.g., tooling, R&D charges), divided by the respective number of
light vehicles produced per year) with a CAGR of approximately 4.4% from 2013 to 2022, despite the
COVID-19 pandemic. Given our technological expertise and our focus on and investment in


-----

innovation, we believe that we are well placed to benefit from the structural megatrends in the
markets that we serve and to transform our portfolio over time from a components supplier to a
complete systems supplier helping to shape progress that moves the world across the areas driving
growth of CO2-efficient drives, chassis applications, industrial machinery & equipment, renewable
energy and aftermarket solutions & services.

**_Resilience based on Diversified and Robust Business Portfolio, Structural Improvements and Cost_**
**_Flexibility_**

Our revenues are diversified across a wide range of bearings and automotive components and
systems and industrial products, generated by thousands of applications for customers across many
diverse end-markets. Within our Automotive Technologies and Automotive Aftermarket Divisions, we
sell approximately 61,100 products and system solutions to OEMs and the aftermarket sector. Within
our Industrial Division, which accounted for 27.0% of our consolidated revenue and 47.7% of our
Adjusted EBIT in 2022, we serve customers in a variety of different sectors, selling approximately
59,200 products and system solutions for a diverse range of applications ranging from wind turbines
to aerospace engines and tool machines. Our end markets are influenced by different economic
factors, making us less vulnerable to adverse changes in the macroeconomic environment or
fluctuations of a particular economic parameter affecting individual regions or market segments. For
example, our Industrial Division recorded a 19.7% increase in revenue in 2022 as compared to 2021
(prior year: 13.9%), despite the impacts of the war in Ukraine, the energy crisis, rising inflation and
the semiconductor shortage, which negatively affected vehicle production and therefore demand for
products of our other Divisions. In addition, the wind sector cluster of our Industrial Division
recorded significant revenue increases in the first half of 2020, despite the COVID-19 pandemic which
resulted in revenue declines in other parts of our business. We also believe that being an integrated
automotive and industrial supplier provides us with significant synergies potential. There are many
overlaps between the different business areas of our Divisions, such as the use of the same materials
and components, the application of the identical production technologies, and the joint purchasing of
raw materials, and we intend to focus even more closely on realizing cross-divisional economies of
scale as well as economies of scope going forward.

Our customer base is also diversified. Our products are sold to OEMs, Tier 1 and Tier 2 suppliers,
aftermarket distributors and service providers in a variety of different sectors. Tier 1 suppliers
produce technologies and solutions geared towards finished products and work directly with OEMs.
Tier 2 suppliers produce specialized parts and components and sell these products to Tier 1 suppliers,
and Tier 3 suppliers provide raw materials and other products. Our key customers include top-tier
OEMs in the global automotive sector as well as leading industrial OEMs. As of December 31, 2022,
we sold our products to all major automotive manufacturers as well as approximately 1,100
automotive suppliers and approximately 5,800 industrial customers in approximately 130 countries
worldwide. In 2022, the Automotive Technologies Division’s top ten customers represented 64.8% of
its revenues, the Automotive Aftermarket’s top ten customers represented 29.5% of its revenues and
the Industrial Division’s top ten customers represented 18.5% of its revenues. We believe this
diversification mitigates counterparty risk and is broader than that of most of our peers.

Our products are often part of platforms that are in service for several years, thereby requiring
continuous aftermarket support and providing a robust revenue stream. In 2022, revenue of our
Automotive Aftermarket Division accounted for 12.9% of our consolidated revenue and 24.4% of our
Adjusted EBIT. In addition, we also generate significant revenue from our industrial aftermarket
business.

Our diversified and high-quality product offering, our focus on our strong positions in our regions and
product segments, our technology and innovation leadership and our proximity to and entrenchment
with our diversified customer base have brought robustness to our sales, with our Automotive
Technologies and Automotive Aftermarket Divisions’ sales volumes having developed better than


-----

underlying automotive production since 2015, with higher growth rates during cyclical upturns and
greater robustness during periods of challenging market conditions including during the COVID-19
pandemic and the geopolitical and economic challenges of 2022. Our ability to pass on a significant
portion of the price increases for nearly all of the input materials key to our operations helped to
mitigate the impact of the war in Ukraine, the energy crisis, rising inflation, the semiconductor
shortage and other challenges in 2022 and protect our margins, particularly in our Industrial and
Automotive Aftermarket Divisions.

Our high degree of diversification, combined with the effects of various structural measures focused
on sustainable efficiency and profitability improvements that we implemented as part of our ongoing
efficiency and portfolio optimization divisional subprograms, and specific cost-efficiency measures
we implemented in early 2020 in response to the declining demand as a result of the COVID-19
pandemic, helped to mitigate its impact on our business and return us to profitability quickly. In
2020, following a challenging first three quarters, we recorded positive EBIT and net income of €270
million and €100 million in the fourth quarter, and we reported positive Adjusted EBIT and cash flows
from operating activities in each quarter, except the second one. In 2021, at €1,266 million, our
Adjusted EBIT returned to pre-COVID-19 levels (Adjusted EBIT for 2019 was €1,161 million) and our
Adjusted EBIT margin of 9.1% in 2021 surpassed that of 8.1% in 2019. (Effective as of January 1, 2022,
we changed our accounting policy for operating assets (see the notes to the Audited Consolidated
Financial Statements 2022). EBIT and related figures in this paragraph have not been adjusted
retrospectively and may, therefore, not be fully comparable to the figures for subsequent periods.
See “Presentation of Financial and Other Information—Presentation of Financial Information” and
“Management’s Discussion and Analysis of Financial Condition and Results of Operations of the
_Schaeffler Group—Key Factors affecting Comparability—Accounting Policy Changes.”)_

**_Strong Production Competence and Broad Global Manufacturing Footprint_**

We consider the efficiency of our manufacturing facilities and processes to be one of our strengths.
We focus on lean manufacturing and continuous improvement and are seen as a reliable partner
with a high level of value added for our customers. In recent years, our expertise in special machinery
construction for digitized, automated and modular production facilities, originally developed as part
of the Technology and Innovation sub-program, has progressed from the development of innovative
production technologies for our own production to become an independent business unit with
external business in 2022.

In addition, we believe that our outstanding know-how in materials, such as steel, our know-how in
surface technology and cold forming technology, our low-cost precision manufacturing processes and
our attention to quality and service are competitive advantages that allow us to consistently provide
high-quality precision products and services. We design and manufacture a number of our tools inhouse and this provides us with unique know-how regarding high-precision manufacturing processes.
Furthermore, we perform most quality-related work in-house, which is designed to ensure that our
products maintain a consistently high standard of quality, as demonstrated by the numerous quality
awards we have won from our customers. We operate 20 R&D centers which focus on creating
proprietary products and systems and provide unique manufacturing know-how to our production
and manufacturing locations.

Our production competence and superior product quality are reinforced by our global manufacturing
footprint, which forms the foundation of our operations and as of December 31, 2022 included 76
plants in 22 countries worldwide, which are characterized by a high level of vertical integration. In
addition, as part of the Ewellix Acquisition in January 2023, we acquired six additional manufacturing
and customization sites in Europe, the U.S. and Asia (please note that the Ewellix Group sites and
employees are not consolidated with the Schaeffler Group plants and employees for purposes of the
discussions of the latter in this Offering Memorandum). Moreover, we have built a geographically
diversified global footprint while ensuring that each of our plants and facilities has a strong regional


-----

foothold, is in close geographic proximity to our customers, and benefits from cost-efficient just-intime logistics. As a result, we are perceived as a local supplier in many markets, and our global
manufacturing and sales platforms allow us to market our products and services to a larger and everglobalizing customer base. Our global footprint, with close proximity to our customers and many of
our suppliers, also reduces complexity of our supply and delivery logistics and helps mitigate the risk
of disruptions in our deliveries to customers and supply chain. Our position as one of the largest
global mechanical components and systems manufacturers further allows us to capitalize on the
growth opportunities associated with globalization and increasing international trade flows, while
making us less susceptible to market risks in any single country or region.

As a result of our global presence, we believe we are very well positioned in our key growth markets,
in particular in the Greater China region, where we have been present for decades.

**_Strong Management Combining Deep Industrial Expertise_**

Our management team has extensive experience in the automotive and industrial sectors and a
proven track record of successfully managing global businesses through economic cycles, including
the economic downturn in connection with the COVID-19 pandemic and the global financial crisis,
and of implementing efficiency and cost reduction measures, such as in our Industrial Division, which
helped improve the Adjusted EBIT margin of the Industrial Division from 7.3% in 2016 to 11.7% in
2022. The successful CORE realignment program improved the efficiency and competitive position of
our Industrial Division by realigning its structure towards stronger customer orientation and
streamlining its leadership structure and the efficiency and portfolio optimization divisional
subprograms and the cost savings measures our management implemented in response to the
COVID-19 pandemic helped us through the difficulties of the COVID-19 pandemic and return us to
profitability quickly. Our management team has also demonstrated its ability to achieve long-term
profitable growth and establish the Schaeffler Group as one of the technology, quality and innovation
leaders in the industry.

Our well-established investor relations and treasury functions have significant capital markets
experience and a superior financing track record that includes many successful bond issuances since
2012 and Schaeffler AG’s IPO and listing on the Frankfurt Stock Exchange in 2015.

### Strategy 

Our vision is to be the automotive and industrial supplier of choice that leads through innovation,
agility and efficiency. To pursue this vision, and building on our specific capabilities and competitive
advantages of innovation, quality, system understanding and manufacturing excellence, we have
established the Roadmap 2025, which sets our strategic direction and defines an integrated program
of measures within and across our three Divisions.

**_Our Strategic Focus Areas_**

Based on five future trends that we expect to have strong impacts on our business and that we
consider strategic opportunities for our future success – sustainability and climate change, new
mobility and electrified powertrain, autonomous production, data economy and digitalization, and
demographic change – we have determined five areas that we intend to focus our strategic efforts
on:

  - _CO2-Efficient Drives: In the context of increasing environmental awareness and the associated_

efforts to decarbonize, supported by various laws and regulations, CO2-efficient drives play an
important role in our automotive business. Based on our profound system understanding up to
the whole-of-vehicle level, we can supply components and systems for all types of powertrains
in order to develop and implement CO2-efficient powertrain solutions together with our
customers. In addition to our current product portfolio, which ranges from solutions for


-----

combustion engines and hybrid solutions to fully electric drive systems, we want to
systematically develop our fuel cell expertise from components and stacks through to systems.
As an important step in this direction, we entered into the joint venture Innoplate, with
Symbio SAS, itself a joint venture of Faurecia and Michelin hydrogen company, to produce fuel
cell bipolar plates, a strategic fuel cell component, for global mobility and energy solutions.
Innoplate is expected to begin large-series production of bipolar plates in 2024, with an initial
production capacity of 4 million bipolar plates per year and the goal to increase production to
around 50 million bipolar plates per year by 2030. We also believe that hydrogen technology
will become important for applications in our industrial business. In addition, we have
developed a 4-in-1 electric powertrain business, which expands on our 2-in-1 and 3-in-1
electric powertrain offerings to add thermal management to the combined transmission,
electric motor and power electronics. We have also entered into a new market segment for
the electrification of heavy duty vehicles, for which we can utilize the same production
machinery that we have developed for light vehicles.

- _Chassis Applications: Developments in chassis applications are driven by the trend towards_

new forms of mobility and the progressive automation of driving functions towards
autonomous driving. We are intensifying our activities at the component and system level,
especially with regard to reliability and safety. This includes the consistent further
development of vehicle components as well as the development of innovative steer-by-wire
solutions for volume production. In addition to innovative chassis applications for the
automotive business, we also focus on autonomous vehicles in the logistics or transport sector.

- _Industrial Machinery and Equipment: With a view to increasing autonomous production, we_

want to offer our customers innovative mechatronic systems for the growing robotics market,
building on and expanding our existing product offering, such as our high-performance and
precise robotic arm actuators, which feature compact electric motor technology based on a
printed circuit board (PCB), coated sensors and low friction bearings with high wear resistance.
As an important step in this direction, we recently acquired the Ewellix Group, a manufacturer
of innovative linear motion and actuation solutions used in assembly automation, medical
applications and mobile machinery and Schaeffler Ultra Precision Drives, a manufacturer of
innovative precision gearboxes for industrial robots. In addition to robotics, we intend to
continue our focus on conventional components for rotary or linear applications.

- _Renewable Energy:_ Against the background of major climate challenges, the global demand for

renewable energy is growing. As a partner to the energy industry, we want to continue to
support the expansion of regenerative energy generation, building further on our
comprehensive portfolio of products that make energy generation from renewable resources
more economical, such as bearings for wind power turbines (with two-thirds of all wind
turbines globally including Schaeffler products, based on our internal estimates) to solutions
for the solar and hydroelectric sectors. This focus area is also an essential part of our
sustainability strategy.

- _Aftermarket Solutions & Services:_ Given the advances being made in autonomous production,

new mobility concepts, vehicle connectivity and the trend towards an increasing data economy
and digitalization, services are becoming an increasingly important part of our offering. In the
industrial space, our customers benefit from our growing portfolio of cost-efficient monitoring
and service solutions (IoT) for broad range of plant and machinery assets, while the increasing
technical complexity and connectivity of vehicles is driving demand for innovative repair
solutions in the automotive sector and the development of new business models and support
services. With the addition of data-based services and innovative plug & play repair solutions
to our portfolio, we are continuing our transition from a components supplier to a provider of
systems and integrated solutions. In addition, we want to offer our customers holistic


-----

solutions, including access to in-vehicle data, through various industrial partnerships within the
automotive aftermarket ecosystem.


-----

**_Implementing Our Strategy_**

As an integral part of our Roadmap 2025 we have developed an execution program, entitled Strategy
2025, to coordinate the implementation of our strategy. Reflecting our organizational and leadership
structure, the Strategy 2025 comprises subprograms for each of our three Divisions as well as four
cross-divisional subprograms.

_Divisional Strategy Programs_

Our Automotive Technologies Division, is focusing its growth efforts on accelerating the portfolio
shift to E-mobility and a successful transition to new and CO2-efficient powertrain and chassis
technologies, in close collaboration with our customers. For this purpose, we plan to invest in the
development of innovative components and systems for new engine technologies, fuel cells, hybrid
and electric drive systems and chassis technologies. As part of this strategy, we commissioned our
first production plant worldwide dedicated to E-mobility in 2021, to manufacture components and
systems, such as electric motors and hybrid drives and it is center for excellence for components and
systems for electrified powertrain. In 2022, we began the expansion of our E-mobility development
and manufacturing campus in Buehl, Germany, to add a new building complex that will serve as a
new center of excellence for E-mobility.

Our Automotive Aftermarket Division is focused on maintaining its high profitability by extending its
digital and service offering, introducing new repair solutions and opening up new ways to the market,
including by establishing new digital sales channels. We also seek to address industry trends, such as
increasing consolidation of distribution partners, changes in the competitive environment, growing
complexity in vehicle technology and a shift from individual components towards customer-oriented
repair solutions and services, by improving our competitiveness, extending our skill base and applying
new business models. In line with this strategy, in 2022, the Automotive Aftermarket Division
launched the first electric axel repair solution “E-Axle RepSystem-G.” The system is scalable and the
Division is developing additional repair solutions based on the system, for example, for electric
motors.

Our Industrial Division is focused on strengthening its leading position in bearings solutions and to
develop and entering new and profitable growth fields, including through the increased use of new
digital and mechatronic technologies. In order to meet our strategic priority of innovation, we strive
to win a key position in the condition monitoring sector and robotics, and we aim to harness
opportunities for our business along the hydrogen production and use chain. The Industrial Division
also aims to make sustainable profitability contributions across the Division and achieve higher
operative value generation over the whole value chain. As part of this strategy, in 2022, we acquired
CERASPIN, a manufacturer of high-quality ceramic components for roller bearings used in a wide
range of strategic growth areas, including wind energy, rail, aerospace, medical equipment, electrical
engineering and the semiconductor industry. In January 2023, we acquired the Ewellix Group, a
manufacturer of innovative linear motion and actuation solutions used in assembly automation,
medical applications and mobile machinery. In addition, in 2022, we entered into a twelve year
partnership with Rolls-Royce through which Rolls-Royce is securing their rolling bearing supply chain
through 2035 and we are making an important step in our growth initiative by supporting Rolls-Royce
with innovative products, R&D excellence and manufacturing capacity.

In addition to the strategic measures we are implementing on a divisional basis, we are also focusing
on four subprograms on a group-wide basis, across our Divisions:

  - _Innovation & Technology: We are strategically managing our product and technology_

innovations in order to strengthen further our position as a pioneer of sustainable mobility and

We have defined specific innovation clusters, including hydrogen and energy transition, and

  - _Digitalization & IT: We focus on reshaping our processes for the digital age through data-_

end-to-end digitalization and automation of our processes and implementation of a robust,

provide future-ready process, data, and IT solutions for our human resources, finance and R&D

  - _People & Culture: We are emphasizing our focus on a high-performance culture through the_

implementation of newly designed remuneration systems that are rigorously focused on
quantitative targets and are encouraging an appreciative and performance-oriented leadership
style and support for employees through measures aimed at modern personnel development
and collaboration as well as even greater diversity within our workforce.

  - _Sustainability & Engagement: We are embedding environmental and social responsibility in_

our value chain as a central success factor for sustainable business operations and are
determined to support our customers in meeting their sustainability obligations. We have also
developed and incorporated a dedicated climate action plan to support the implementation of
measures required to achieve climate neutrality.

**_Our Approach to Capital and Portfolio Management_**

Through our investment and capital allocation framework we seek to drive consistent capital
deployment and shift R&D spending to new technologies and future growth areas. In this context, we
categorized our businesses as either “mature” or “new” and then further divided those into four
portfolio strategies based on growth potential and return on capital employed: “build” and “grow”
for our new businesses and “harvest” and “exit/divest” for our mature businesses. For our “build”
and “grow” businesses, we plan with a reinvestment rate, defined as the ratio of capital expenditures
to depreciation and amortization, of significantly above 1.0, to fuel growth. Those businesses
categorized as “harvest” and “exit/divest” only receive the required capital to sustain cash
generation. In this way, we actively manage our portfolio with the goal of ensuring profitability in
mature businesses and strong growth in new businesses.

Particularly in the Automotive Technologies Division we will increasingly distinguish between mature
business and new business in the future, as the transformation towards innovative powertrain and
chassis technologies progresses. In our mature businesses, we are “harvesting” profitable enablertechnologies for the powertrain agnostic automotive bearings market, and optimized combustion
engines and “exiting/divesting” expiring businesses, reducing complexity, and consolidating our
footprint in Europe with a focus on Germany. Among our “mature” businesses, we have divested our
stake in Bio-Hybrid GmbH, which developed a four-wheel pedelec bike, known as the “Bio-Hybrid”
and sold our global chain drive business. In our new businesses, particularly to further enhance our EMobility BD products and services and our Chassis Systems BD products and services, we are
“growing” in electrified powertrains, fuel cells and chassis mechatronics and “building” competencies
in electrified powertrains and hydrogen. We have developed a 4-in-1 electric powertrain business,
which expands on our 2-in-1 and 3-in-1 electric powertrain offerings to add thermal management to
the combined transmission, electric motor and power electronics. We have also entered into a new
market segment for the electrification of heavy duty vehicles, for which we can utilize the same
production machinery that we have developed for light vehicles.

We believe that hydrogen fuel cells offer a potential alternative to pure electric battery solutions,
which have disadvantages for the heavy duty vehicle segment, in particular for long-haul use, and will
become more relevant in 2025-2030. We have therefore launched a broad initiative on hydrogen to
explore the use of hydrogen fuel cells for various potential applications across all our Divisions,
efforts which we categorize as “build.” We plan to capitalize on our existing expertise, for example, in
manufacturing bipolar plates, to develop complete hydrogen fuel cell systems. In 2022, we entered
into our joint venture Innoplate, with Symbio SAS, itself a joint venture of Faurecia and Michelin
hydrogen company, to produce fuel cell bipolar plates, a strategic fuel cell component, for global
mobility and energy solutions. Innoplate is expected to begin large-series production of bipolar plates
in 2024, with an initial production capacity of 4 million bipolar plates per year and the goal to
increase production to around 50 million bipolar plates per year by 2030. We also began a shared
research program with Johnson Matthey, Bekaert and TNO, in 2022, to accelerate proton exchange
membrane (“PEM”) electrolyzer technology development, by optimizing the most important
components of the electrolyzer stack. We also signed a letter of intent in 2022 with Lhyfe, a French
green hydrogen producer, for Lhyfe to construct and operate an industrial electrolysis plant on our
site in Herzogenaurach, Germany, with a capacity of up to 15 MW. We expect the plant to start
operations in 2025 and to supply our Herzogenaurach plant and other regional customers with
approximately 3.7 tons of green hydrogen daily. The agreement with Lhyfe also sets out a technology
partnership to promote the use of our electrolysis stacks.

**_Our Focus on Profitable Growth_**

We pursue a strategy of mainly organic growth, based on our existing technological expertise and
innovation capabilities. With respect to external growth, we intend to focus on small bolt-on
acquisitions that either expand our technological expertise or strengthen our market position
(particularly in the areas of automotive aftermarket, chassis mechatronics, power electronics &
electronics manufacturing, hydrogen, Lifetime Solutions, mechatronics and systems and rotative and
linear components). In the evaluation and execution of acquisitions we intend to follow a disciplined
approach with clear guidelines, including, among others, that acquired businesses must be earnings
accretive within one year of their integration and their return on capital employed must be greater
than their working average cost of capital within two years.

On the basis of our investment and capital allocation framework we have defined 12 growth
initiatives to express the focus of our growth efforts:

In our Automotive Technologies Division, these focus on E-drives for electric powertrains; customercentric electric axles for hybrid and electric powertrains, which are an important element of growth
in the E-mobility area; dedicated hybrid transmissions for hybrid powertrains, encompassing
innovative and efficient dedicated hybrid transmissions and hybrid modules; future engine
**_technologies for all powertrains, particularly in the context of electrified powertrains; and chassis_**
**_mechatronic solutions for assisted and automated mobility._**

In our Automotive Aftermarket Division, the growth initiatives focus on aftermarket wheel bearings
for passenger cars to be the one-stop shop for our customers; plug and play repair solutions for
**_garages to address the increased complexity of repairs and meet the demand for high-quality and_**
convenient repairs; and a transparent and user-friendly B2B platform developed by us that connects
manufacturers, dealers, and resellers of automotive parts in China (the “ETC Platform China”).

In our Industrial Division, the growth initiatives focus on large-size bearings for the wind industry to
offer our customers bearing solutions that meet the most rigorous requirements in terms of quality,
reliability, and durability; robotics for industrial automation to help shape the increasing automation
of industrial production with products such as our systems solutions for robotics; for both industrial
robots and “cobots” (collaborative robots), we intend to offer a broad product range, from
innovative bearing solutions to high-precision robotic arm joints and high-performance linear
actuators, thereby extending the application of robot technologies in work environments; and service
**_solutions for industrial applications, including a wide range of innovative condition monitoring and_**
lubrication solutions to increase plant availability and improve safety in the production environment.

As cross-divisional growth initiative across our Automotive Technologies and Industrial Divisions, we
intend to focus on hydrogen for automotive and industrial applications with areas of application
ranging from energy generation and storage to zero-emission drive solutions. We believe that our
core competences in material, forming, and surface coating technology will enable us to develop
efficient volume production for key components for the future hydrogen economy, along the entire
energy chain.

Geographically, we intend to continue to expand our presence in growth markets, for example in the
Greater China and the Asia/Pacific regions which have been growth drivers for all of our Divisions.
We expect the largest increase in both vehicle population and demand for repairs to occur outside of
Europe through 2025. To expand our presence in the Greater China and Asia/Pacific regions, we have
been opening or expanding local plants, such as the opening of a new production hall in Nanjing,
China and a large size bearing refurbishment center in India in 2021, a new manufacturing plant and
a new center for software and electronics development in in India in 2022, and we plan to expand
our campus in Taicang, China. In 2020, we started our ETC Platform China and, in 2021, we entered
into an agreement with Shanghai REFIRE Group Limited to cooperate on the development and
manufacture of key components for hydrogen fuel cells in 2021.

**_Our Focus on Sustainability_**

Sustainability is an anchor of our Roadmap 2025 strategy and means being economically successful
while at the same time assuming responsibility for the environment and society.

While sustainability represents a significant component of our corporate values and is considered a
task of society as a whole, it is also an opportunity for business growth. A key example is the rapid
acceleration of electrification and a significant increase in battery and fuel cell powered vehicles. As a
global technology company, we are actively shaping the far-reaching transformation of mobility and
energy solutions. Together with our customers, we take a holistic approach to developing innovative
product solutions for the demands of the future, including climate-friendly energy generation and
alternative drives, intelligent repair solutions and new mobility concepts, and energy-efficient,
material and process optimized bearing technologies.

We strive to become a leader of innovation in E-mobility by offering our customers innovations and
development expertise in E-mobility on both a system and component level and products covering
many areas of electrification, from mild hybridization to all-electric driving. Our electric axle drives,
which entered into volume production in 2021, have set a new benchmark for the output density of
electric transmissions. We also began volume production of electric motors for hybrid modules,
hybrid transmissions, and all-electric axle drives in 2021. We also believe that hydrogen will play a
decisive role in fundamentally changing the entire energy and mobility sector and will become more
relevant from 2025 and are therefore focusing on it as a growth initiative across our Automotive
Technologies and Industrial Divisions. In 2022, we entered into our joint venture Innoplate, with
Symbio SAS, to produce fuel cell bipolar plates, a strategic fuel cell component, for global mobility
and energy solutions. Innoplate is expected to begin large-series production of bipolar plates in 2024,
with an initial production capacity of 4 million bipolar plates per year and the goal to increase
production to around 50 million bipolar plates per year by 2030.

We understand sustainability as a cross-functional task. With our Sustainability Strategy, we address
ten action fields such as climate neutrality, circularity and occupational health and safety. In 2022,
overall responsibility for sustainability within the Schaeffler Group was transferred to our Chief
Executive Officer. We also adopted a more decentralized and topic-specific decision-making
approach for sustainability issues and established a dedicated sustainability network across all
Divisions, functions and regions. We have also adopted group wide sustainability goals. With respect
to the environment, these goals address, among others, the increase in energy efficiency, the
purchase of renewable energies and climate-neutral production across all regions by 2030. And since
our commitment to sustainability is not confined to just the Schaeffler Group but extends to our
suppliers, we have also included the purchasing of production materials from suppliers with
sustainability self-assessments as one of our goals as well as climate-neutral production across all
regions, including the entire supply chain, by 2040. In 2022, the global non-profit Carbon Disclosure
Project (CDP), which is a leading environmental disclosure database and sets the standard for
corporate environmental disclosure transparency, awarded us the highest rating of “A” in the
categories of climate change and water security, recognizing our leadership in disclosure and
performance in those categories. For more information on our sustainability goal, see “—
_Environment, Social and Governance.”_

Our sustainability goals not only express our ambitions, but are also key tools for performance
measurement and management. Since 2020, the achievement of sustainability goals has been
integrated into the variable compensation of our top management team.
